key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have experienced at least eight paparazzi incidents since moving to California.
Recent photos captured Prince Harry with James Corden filming on a tourist bus in L.A. for 'The Late Late Show'.
Harry and Meghan filed two lawsuits last year against picture agencies over unsolicited photographs.
One featured event was a COVID-safe edition of Carpool Karaoke with James Corden, featuring adequate safety measures.
Photographs of the couple have been widely distributed, including images of them in Beverly Hills and with friends David Foster and Katharine McPhee.
They were also photographed during a trip that was speculated to be to a dentist.
A lawsuit was filed against picture agency X17 for using a drone to photograph their son, Archie, leading to an apology and settlement from X17.
The couple's lawyer stated the lawsuit aimed to protect their son's privacy and uncover those profiting from illegal actions.
Early in their California stay, they were photographed delivering parcels for Project Angel Food, a charity aiding vulnerable individuals during the lockdown.
Other incidents include being photographed near the Beverly Hills mansion they stayed at, loaned by Tyler Perry.
